column4: Howdy all, does anybody in here know how I can diagnose network lag I'm getting in Ubuntu?
I'm using a wireless connection with Wicd installed.
It just happened about four days ago.
did you have a kernel, or wireless related, update for days ago?
flash is a poor example of audio/video troubles?
flash is a poor example or network troubles.
Nope, no kernel update and I remember having a Linux Network Firmware driver about a week or two ago. But doubt that affected it.
Indeed but when I also try to downloading some stuff I get about 1Mbps instead of the 3.2Mbps I normally get.
The default network-manager is highly unstable and continuously disconnects me from the Internet.
i actually use wicd on my netbook, i'm NOT bad mouthing it!
fyi though, wicd is basically considered "deprecated" by ubuntu's upstream, debian.
As long as it works right. :P

too bad i can't suggest you point /etc/apt/apt.conf to your apt-cacher (or apt-cacher-ng) server.  'cause i assume you don't have one (or you wouldn't be asking).  sorry i have no idea on you USC issue, good luck.
No problem seems a mystery to me.
and jmstick I tried power cycling the router/cable modem it seemed to revert my 1Mbps back to the 3.2Mbps I was currently getting so I'm good now. :)
